Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen so last 
week I showed you how to make homemade thai-style

chicken stock and today it is the perfect 
recipe to use that chicken stock for so I'm

making chicken noodle soup Thai style and when I 
say high style I mean this is the stuff that you

can find sold by street vendors all over Thailand 
and it's actually one of the simplest noodle soups

to make when we make noodle soup at home chances 
are it's this one in Thai this is called guay tiew

gai cheek guay tiew means noodle gai is chicken 
and cheek means to pull and yes we are going

to be pulling chicken for this and as you'll see 
this is sort of like very similar to fur but with

Thai flavors let's get started so what I've got in 
this pot is my chicken stock that I just made and

I highly encourage you to not use store-bought 
for this because if you do you're not going to

get that flavor that is iconic of Thai noodle soup 
okay to this I'm going to season it with some soy

sauce and of course some fish sauce and you know 
I asked soy sauce and fish sauce in combination

because even though they're both salty agents they 
have different flavors soy sauce a little smoother

or fish sauce a little sharper and together they 
really create something well balanced and a little

more complex that's balanced at salt I am going 
to add some sugar now just going to bring this

to a simmer while that's going let's talk about 
the chicken so this is just boneless skinless

chicken breast but I have cuts very strategically 
so what I did is first I separated the tender and

then with what you've got left you want to look 
at where the fiber runs okay and then you want

to make a cut that divides that fiber in half so 
then when you go to pull the chicken you don't

get long pieces of you know chicken fiber you get 
short bite-sized pieces okay and then I'm simply

going to poach this in our stock so the stock is 
just coming to a simmer now I'm going to add the

chicken gently don't splash yourself and then what 
I'm going to do is I'm going to let the chicken

post at a very still simmer now I know that sounds 
weird but here's what I mean basically you've got

steam coming off the top the whole time but it's 
not bubbling okay and that temperature is going to

cook your chicken all the way through but it's not 
going to overcook the outside okay and also that's

the reason why I cut the chicken in half because 
the smaller the piece the more evenly it's going

to cook if you throw the whole chicken breast 
net it's going to take a long time by the time

the inside cooks outsides overcook so this is a 
lot faster and the tender will only take three to

five minutes to cook so we want to pull that out 
first and then the rest of the pieces will pay

in my experience seven to ten minutes so I have 
meat thermometer it's definitely handy to have

all right so these are done and if you're using 
a thermometer you want it to be at 165 degrees

Fahrenheit and I'm going to let these cool for 
now so I can peel pull them without burning my

hands now that we have our guy I am going to cheat 
my guy simply by pulling it yay and because you

have cut the chicken in half then the pieces are 
like nice bite-sized lengths you know and you just

get your kids involved and tear out the little 
pieces alright so now that you've got your guy

cheek I'm going to season this a little bit with 
fish sauce because right now there isn't a whole

lot of flavor going on but you just need a splash 
and this is way more than you need for the noodle

soup but they're really handy to throw into pasta 
sauces and the soup into fried rice but you just

realize how useful having just bits of cooked 
chicken is in the fridge now in addition to the

fish sauce I'm also going to add some garlic oil 
now garlic oil is something you're going to need

for the noodle soup anyway I'm just putting some 
over the chicken because in addition to flavor is

prevented from drying out because now you've got 
really thin pieces of lean chicken and if you let

this sit while you're doing other things that can 
easily dry out and add in garlic flavor to chicken

I mean come on what can go wrong right mmm that's 
ready to go on your soup so let's take a look at

the other ingredients for this now those soaps 
the only hard part about noodle sauce if there

is a hard part is getting all the ingredients 
ready okay so let's talk noodles first so the

noodles I'm using for this is rice noodles small 
size the same kind you find in Vietnamese pho now

this comes dry like this this is the one I use it 
doesn't have to be this brand and all I did was I

soaked it in room-temperature water for about 15 
minutes or however long it takes for it to become

pliable like this if your water is really cold it 
will take a little longer but you don't want to

let it go you know for hours because it can be 
over soaked and then you noodles will overcook

really quickly so once it's pliable you can remove 
it from the water yes of course you can use any

other kinds of noodles that you wish I also have 
some chicken balls so we have some chicken breasts

but now we need some chicken balls I buy them 
just like this oh I didn't make them and it's

so commonly added to Thai noodle soups if you're 
if you're using a pork based soup then they'll

use pork balls if you're using if you're eating 
fish noodle soup that's fish balls and you can

easily find this at Asian grocery stores some bean 
sprouts bean sprouts just add a little crunch if

you don't like it you can opt to not put it in 
I've got spinach any baby greens like Danny bok

choy would be good any sort of greens that you 
would like in your soup as long as the flavor is

quite mild I just like you spinach because it's 
easy to find cilantro and green onions I mean

these are optional and this guy over here this 
is something that we add in many types of noodle

soup this is called some chai so there are little 
bits of cabbage that's been preserved in salt and

so they become sort of little salty crunchy chewy 
bits in your noodle so think like they can get but

cabbage okay and then in terms of condiment I've 
got the garlic oil in the fried garlic I chop some

garlic it fried it in the oil I separate them okay 
it's going to add nice garlicky flavor to your

noodle soup I've got some chili flakes and some 
chili vinegar and chili vinegar super easy chili

vinegar garlic in the blender and all the details 
of how to make all this I will load in the written

recipe so I am ready to go I've got my broth my

added the chicken balls in there so they can heat 
up with the broth I've got my pot of boiling water

here which I'm going to use to blanch my noodles 
and my vegetables and yes you can put everything

all at the same time if you don't have something 
like this you've also seen me use that like

Chinese style noodle strainer or maybe Taizo I 
don't know what that is but like a more cup shaped

noodle strainer or whatever you have that'll work 
okay going in and one two three four five that's

it up now and remember the the broth is going 
to be hot boiling hot when you pour it over it's

going to continue to cook the noodles a little bit 
more okay I'm going to switch pots real quick I'm

also going to add the chicken balls in at the same 
time there you go especially if you're making like

lots of different bowls and you're not ready to 
eat right now it's even more important that you

don't over cook the noodles because that's going 
to sit for a little bit right okay so now all the

condiments go in oh and before I eat if you think

oh that is so good flashbacks of all that brah 
it's such a perfect balance of flavor that's soft

if you spend a good amount of effort on making a 
good sock you're halfway there I mean everything

else is just little ingredients here and there but 
if you pay attention to your socks it makes all

the difference it's if one of those Thai dishes 
is not like strong fighting hearts our you know

like some pie dishes can be but it's the epitome 
of comfort food I really encourage you could

give this noodle soup a try I mean it is chicken

yet it's a lot of little ingredients that you have 
to put together but there are a lot of things that

you can make in advance there's a lot of things
